text: [Music]
are you looking at all of this spinach
and thinking what on earth are you doing
with all that spinach sir actually I'm
making an amazing hot spinach dip so as
a couple teaspoons of oil the garlic and
one onion to a large pot now you can
start adding your spinach it's two
pounds of spinach and you can still
leave a little bit of water clinging to
the leaves which will help it wilt down
in the pot I always get a little
overwhelmed by spinach in the beginning
and you need to buy so much one thing
you can do if you want to if use frozen
here you can get a couple packages of
frozen spinach to replace this gonna add
all the spinach and then I'm gonna cover
it up and let it wilt that way it does
cook more quickly if it's covered look
at that as promised it's completely
wilted down and drain your spinach and
squeeze out the excess liquid you can do
that just by pressing on the spinach and
you have to make a sauce so you might as
well just let it sit in the colander and
some of that liquid will drain out on
its own in the same pot that you wilted
your spinach add a half a cup of milk
and to the milk you add 6 ounces of
low-fat cream cheese I like to whisk
this until it gets smooth the cream
cheese thickens the sauce all on its own
so you don't need to worry about making
a bechamel which you normally would make
for a sauce like this to this add a
quarter cup of grated mozzarella cheese
some hot sauce a few shakes a little bit
of Worcestershire same thing about three
shakes I mean it's up to you it's to
taste salt and pepper now stir in your
spinach I mean it's basically creamed
spinach with some cheese and then you
bake it which makes it Bui gooey and
fantastic and then just transfer your
mixture can you believe that was two
pounds of spinach bread it evenly into
the dish and then sprinkle with another
half a cup of mozzarella cheese get it
into the oven and bake it until it's
golden brown and bubbly that'll take
about 25 minutes
look at that guys I think you're gonna

gooey delicious spinach dip for your
